de.polygonal.ds.ArrayedQueue<T>

type
class
implements
Queue<T>

An arrayed queue based on an arrayed circular queue.

A queue is a linear list for which all insertions are made at one end of the list; all deletions (and usually all accesses) are made at the other end.

This is called a FIFO structure (First In, First Out).

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

See http://lab.polygonal.de/?p=189

Constructor

new(capacity : Int, ?isResizable : Bool, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
capacity the initial physical space for storing the elements at the time the queue is created. This is also the minimum size of this queue. The capacity is automatically adjusted according to the storage requirements based on three rules:
  1. If this queue runs out of space, the capacity is doubled (if isResizable is true).
  2. If the size() falls below a quarter of the current capacity, the capacity is cut in half.
  3. The minimum capacity equals capacity.
isResizable if true, the capacity is automatically adjusted.
Otherwise capacity defines both the minimum and maximum allowed capacity. Default is true.
maxSize the maximum allowed size of this queue.
The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError reserved size is greater than allowed size (debug only).

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this queque.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only). A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

reuseIterator : Bool

If true, reuses the iterator object instead of allocating a new one when calling iterator().
The default is false.
If true, nested iterations are likely to fail as only one iteration is allowed at a time.

Instance Methods

assign(C : Class<T>, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?n : Int) : Void

parameters
C the class to instantiate for each element.
args passes additional constructor arguments to the class C.
n the number of elements to replace. If 0, n is set to capacity.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError n out of range (debug only).
Replaces up to n existing elements with objects of type C. n

inline back() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError queue is empty (debug only).
Returns the rear element.
This is the "newest" element. 1

inline clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, elements are nullified upon removal and capacity is set to the initial capacity defined in the constructor.
Removes all elements. 1 or n if purge is true

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this queue. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this queue contains the element x. n

inline cpy(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError queue is empty (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i equals j (debug only).
Replaces the element at index i with the element from index j.
The index is measured relative to the index of the front element (= 0). 1

inline dequeue() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError queue is empty (debug only).
Dequeues and returns the front element.
To allow instant garbage collection of the dequeued element call dequeue() followed by dispose(). 1

inline dispose() : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError dispose() wasn't directly called after dequeue()(debug only).
Nullifies the last dequeued element so it can be garbage collected.
Use only directly after dequeue(). 1

inline enqueue(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError out of space - queue is full but not resizable.
Enqueues the element x. 1

fill(x : T, ?n : Int) : Void

parameters
n the number of elements to replace. If 0, n is set to capacity.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError n out of range (debug only).
Replaces up to n existing elements with the instance of x. n

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all elements for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional). n

inline get(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError queue is empty (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns the element at index i.
The index is measured relative to the index of the front element (= 0). 1

inline getCapacity() : Int

The size of the allocated storage space for the elements.
If more space is required to accomodate new elements, the capacity is doubled every time size() grows beyond capacity, and split in half when size() is a quarter of capacity. The capacity never falls below the initial size defined in the constructor. 1

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this queue is empty. 1

inline isFull() : Bool

Returns true if this queue is full. 1

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new ArrayedQueueIterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this queue.
Preserves the natural order of a queue (First-In-First-Out).

pack() : Void

For performance reasons the queue does nothing to ensure that empty locations contain null.
pack() therefore nullifies all obsolete references. n

inline peek() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError queue is empty (debug only).
Returns the front element.
This is the "oldest" element. 1

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if at least one occurrence of x was removed.
Removes and nullifies all occurrences of the element x. n

inline set(i : Int, x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError queue is empty (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Replaces the element at index i with the element x.
The index is measured relative to the index of the front element (= 0). 1

shuffle(?rval : DA<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval a list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive) defining the new positions of the elements. If omitted, random values are generated on-the-fly by calling Math.random().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError insufficient random values (debug only).
Shuffles the elements of this collection by using the Fisher-Yates algorithm. n

inline size() : Int

The total number of elements. 1

inline swp(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError queue is empty (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i equals j (debug only).
Swaps the element at index i with the element at index j.
The index is measured relative to the index of the front element (= 0). 1

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an array containing all elements in this queue.
Preserves the natural order of this queue (First-In-First-Out).

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns a dense array containing all elements in this queue.
Preserves the natural order of this queue (First-In-First-Out).

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  var queue = new de.polygonal.ds.ArrayedQueue<Int>(4);
	  for (i in 0...queue.capacity) {
	      queue.enqueue(i);
	  }
	  trace(queue);
	  {ArrayedQueue, size/capacity: 4/4}
	  |< front
	    0 -> 0
	    1 -> 1
	    2 -> 2
	    3 -> 3
	  >|

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns a Vector.<T> object containing all elements in this queue.
Preserves the natural order of this queue (First-In-First-Out).

walk(process : T -> Int -> T) : Void

Invokes the process function for each element.
The function signature is: process(oldValue, index):newValue n
